contextId.information: These two words basically mean the same and emphasize how much the Israelites suffered. AT: "terribly oppressed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words basically have the same meaning repeated to emphasize how important Jephthah had became. You can combine the two words. AT: "commander" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "advice" and "counsel" refer to the same thing and are repeated for emphasis. They can be combined. AT: "decide what we need to do about this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: give your advice and counsel here
